meanings.definition: To shine brighter than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sun was outsparkling the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outsparkled all the other smiles in the room.
meanings.sent3: The little firefly thought it was outsparkling the moon.
meanings.sent4: The diamond outsparkled all the other gems in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outsparkled the city skyline, lighting up the night.

meanings.definition: To outshine or surpass in brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks were outsparkling the full moon that night.
meanings.sent2: His talent for singing outsparkled all the other contestants.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's laughter could outsparkle the brightest diamond.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence outsparkled her classmates, always getting the highest grades.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the show outsparkled all the previous acts, leaving the audience in awe.
